intro: Calceolaria weberbaueriana, commonly known as the Weberbauer's slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its striking, slipper-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is known for its delicate, hairy foliage. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
